abstract: American success and growth has drawn on a deep partnership between business and government, a history and practical approach that many Republicans seem eager to deny, an economist writes.
snippet: American success and growth has drawn on a deep partnership between business and government, a history and practical approach that many Republicans seem eager to deny, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and former chief economist at the International Monetary Fund. His books include “13 Bankers.”
